result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond W Hanson

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1500.00

1:30 PM Defendant Raymond W Hanson appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given.  Court reviews the files.  Victim rights are complied with.  Victim is not present.  Warrant is quashed by the court.  Clerk to start forf proceedings on the signature bond.  Court sets bond.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:03 PM Defendant Raymond W Hanson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called appearances given.  Deft does not appear.  Attorney in 21CF319 had and conflict and wrote to the courts and is set for scheduling.  Victim rights are complied with Victim is not present.  Attorney laufenberg advised the deft that he needed to appear in person today.  State is requesting a warrant in 22CF260 and 22CF261 Court grants the warrants

1:38 PM - cases called - 22CF260 and 22CF261.  Defendant Raymond W Hanson appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaints - waives readings - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions Defendant regarding bond.  Response by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights in 22CF261.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court directs bond forfeiture proceedings on the cash bond(s) on the Defendant's other matter(s).
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
